Thanks I find this fascinating I used this method to solve 73•836  I did it twice for each digit multiplied the added the two results so I only really need to multiply by single digits numbers which is why I also divided 70 by 10 to make it easier to multiply by 7 instead of 70 then I later multiplied it back by 10.    3(100•8+10•3+6) (3•100•8)+(3•10•3)+(3•6) 3•8=24•100=2400 3•3=9•10=90 3•6=18  (2400)+(90)+(18)= 2508  ***70/10=7***  7(100•8+10•3+6) (7•100•8)+(7•10•3)+(7•6)  7•8=56•100=5600 7•3=21•10=210 7•6=42  (5600)+(210)+(42)=5852  ***5852•10=58520***    2508+ 58520= 61028  73•836 = 2508+58520 = 61028
